fields.value: ABC News ESPN O.J. Simpson Interview Poll, January 1998

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This special topic poll sought respondents' views on O.J.   Simpson, especially his comments during a recent interview with   Esquire magazine, in which Simpson was quoted as saying, "Let's say I   committed this crime. Even if I did do this, it would have been   because I loved her very much, right?" Respondents were asked whether   they believed that Simpson killed h
is ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson   and her friend Ronald Goldman, whether Simpson should be removed from   the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and whether news shows should have him   as an interview guest. The results of the poll were announced on the   ESPN sports network. Background information on respondents includes  age, sex, race, and ethnicity.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-11-28Version Text: 2006-11-28Version Date: 2006-11-28Version Text: 2006-11-28 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SAS, SPSS, and Stata setup files have  been added to this data collection.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Card Image with SAS, SPSS, and Stata setup files;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) This collection has not been processed by ICPSR   staff. ICPSR is distributing the data and documentation for this   collection in essentially the same form in which they were received.   When appropriate, hardcopy documentation has been converted to   machine-readable form and variables have been recoded to ensure   respondents' anonymity. (2) The codebook is provided as a Portable   Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed by   Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader   software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to   obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR   Website on the Internet. (3) A weight variable with two implied  decimal places has been included and must be used in any analysis.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
